project.title: Generation of synthetic brain tumors
project.description: Development of a pipeline to generate synthetic tumors into MRI scans using GANs. BraTS dataset used for development. Multiple award winner.

project.title: Quality control of data synthetically generated
project.description: Investigated GANs and Diffusion Models for medical image synthesis (CT/MRI), rigorously validating realism and utility using Radiomics, VTT, and DSC for segmentation tasks.

project.title: Deep learning pipeline for highly accurate automated segmentation of Head and Neck Cancer GTVs in multi-timepoint MRI.
project.description: First place winner in the HNTS-MRG24 MICCAI Challenge for automated Head and Neck Cancer GTV segmentation in MRI-guided radiotherapy. Developed and optimized a multi-model deep learning pipeline (nnUNet/MedNeXt) achieving a state-of-the-art aggregated Dice Similarity Coefficient of 0.8254.

project.title: Generation of Synthetic Rat Brain MRI scans with a 3D Enhanced Alpha-GAN
project.description: Pioneered the first GAN-based approach to generate realistic 3D synthetic rat brain MRI scans, addressing critical data scarcity and ethical (3Rs) challenges in translational neuroscience. Validated model realism using quantitative metrics, a Turing Test, and segmentation applications, demonstrating that synthetic data outperformed conventional data augmentation in improving segmentation model performance.
